title: Awesome List Updates on Apr 14, 2020

items.title: Awesome Cassandra
items.content_text:
### Books / Custom Time Series

*   [Cassandra: The Definitive Guide, 3rd Edition](https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/1098115163/)
items.content_html:

items.title: Awesome Lidar
items.content_text:
### Datasets

*   [EU Long-term Dataset](https://epan-utbm.github.io/utbm_robocar_dataset/) - This dataset was collected with our robocar (in human driving mode of course), equipped up to eleven heterogeneous sensors, in the downtown (for long-term data) and a suburb (for roundabout data) of Montbéliard in France. The vehicle speed was limited to 50 km/h following the French traffic rules.
items.content_html:
Datasets

  • EU Long-term Dataset - This dataset was collected with our robocar (in human driving mode of course), equipped up to eleven heterogeneous sensors, in the downtown (for long-term data) and a suburb (for roundabout data) of Montbéliard in France. The vehicle speed was limited to 50 km/h following the French traffic rules.

items.title: Awesome Cl
items.content_text:
### Readline, ncurses and other graphical helpers / Third-party APIs

*   [replic (⭐39)](https://github.com/vindarel/replic/) - helpers to turn existing code into a readline application, with a focus on defining the completion of the commands' arguments. Also comes as a ready to use executable, that transforms a user's lispy init file into readline commands. [MIT](https://opensource.org/licenses/MIT).
*   [cl-ansi-term (⭐32)](https://github.com/vindarel/cl-ansi-term) - print
    colorized text, horizontal lines, progress bars, (un)ordered lists
    and tables on ANSI-compliant terminals. [GPL3](http://www.gnu.org/copyleft/gpl.html).

### Shells, shells interfaces / Third-party APIs

*   [Shelly (⭐64)](https://github.com/fukamachi/shelly) - execute Common Lisp
    functions like a shell command, without the need to write a command
    line arguments parser. And it also can be used as a Make-like
    build-tool. [FreeBSD](https://directory.fsf.org/wiki?title=License:FreeBSD).
items.content_html:
Readline, ncurses and other graphical helpers / Third-party APIs

  • replic (⭐39) - helpers to turn existing code into a readline application, with a focus on defining the completion of the commands' arguments. Also comes as a ready to use executable, that transforms a user's lispy init file into readline commands. MIT.
  • cl-ansi-term (⭐32) - print colorized text, horizontal lines, progress bars, (un)ordered lists and tables on ANSI-compliant terminals. GPL3.

Shells, shells interfaces / Third-party APIs

  • Shelly (⭐64) - execute Common Lisp functions like a shell command, without the need to write a command line arguments parser. And it also can be used as a Make-like build-tool. FreeBSD.

items.title: Awesome Waves
items.content_text:
### Stagenet

*   [Explorer](https://wavesexplorer.com/stagenet) - Official explorer. It has a [faucet](https://wavesexplorer.com/stagenet/faucet) for getting a few free Waves tokens.
*   [Node API](https://nodes-stagenet.wavesnodes.com/) - Swagger REST API of Waves Node.
items.content_html:
Stagenet

  • Explorer - Official explorer. It has a faucet for getting a few free Waves tokens.
  • Node API - Swagger REST API of Waves Node.

items.title: Awesome Standard
items.content_text:

*   **[wemake-frontend-styleguide (⭐82)](https://github.com/wemake-services/wemake-frontend-styleguide)** - JavaScript & TypeScript & Vue & JsDoc & Scss style guides based on standard tools. Very strict!

code/project generators

items.title: Awesome Embedded and Iot Security
items.content_text:
### Case Studies / RFID NFC Tools

*   [Dumping firmware from a device's SPI flash with a buspirate](https://www.iotpentest.com/2019/06/dumping-firmware-from-device-using.html)

### Websites / Tutorials and Technical Background

*   [Azeria Lab](https://azeria-labs.com/) - Miscellaneous ARM related Tutorials.
*   [JTAG Explained](https://blog.senr.io/blog/jtag-explained#) - A walkthrough covering UART and JTAG bypassing a protected login shell.
*   [Reverse Engineering Serial Ports](http://www.devttys0.com/2012/11/reverse-engineering-serial-ports/) - Detailed tutorial about how to spot debug pads on a PCB.
*   [UART explained](https://www.mikroe.com/blog/uart-serial-communication) - An in depth explanation of the UART protocol.
items.content_html:
Case Studies / RFID NFC Tools

  • Dumping firmware from a device's SPI flash with a buspirate

Websites / Tutorials and Technical Background

  • Azeria Lab - Miscellaneous ARM related Tutorials.
  • JTAG Explained - A walkthrough covering UART and JTAG bypassing a protected login shell.
  • Reverse Engineering Serial Ports - Detailed tutorial about how to spot debug pads on a PCB.
  • UART explained - An in depth explanation of the UART protocol.

items.title: Awesome Ssh
items.content_text:
### Apps / Network

*   [sshuttle (⭐12k)](https://github.com/sshuttle/sshuttle) [![stars](https://img.shields.io/github/stars/sshuttle/sshuttle.svg?style=social\&label=stars)](https://github.com/sshuttle/sshuttle) - Transparent proxy server that works as a poor man's *VPN*. Forwards over `ssh`. Doesn't require admin. Works with *Linux* and *MacOS*. Supports *DNS tunneling*.

### Apps / Automation

*   [parallel-ssh (⭐1.2k)](https://github.com/ParallelSSH/parallel-ssh) [![stars](https://img.shields.io/github/stars/ParallelSSH/parallel-ssh.svg?style=social\&label=stars)](https://github.com/ParallelSSH/parallel-ssh) - Provides parallel versions of OpenSSH and related tools.

### Apps / Alternatives to *SSH*

*   [ttyd (⭐9.4k)](https://github.com/tsl0922/ttyd) [![stars](https://img.shields.io/github/stars/tsl0922/ttyd.svg?style=social\&label=stars)](https://github.com/tsl0922/ttyd) - Share your terminal over the web.
items.content_html:
Apps / Network

  • sshuttle (⭐12k) - Transparent proxy server that works as a poor man's VPN. Forwards over ssh. Doesn't require admin. Works with Linux and MacOS. Supports DNS tunneling.

Apps / Automation

  • parallel-ssh (⭐1.2k) - Provides parallel versions of OpenSSH and related tools.

Apps / Alternatives to SSH

  • ttyd (⭐9.4k) - Share your terminal over the web.
